scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler and Joey are playing with the duck and the
chick.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, wouldn't be cool if our duck and chick had a little baby? We could call it Chuck.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Or... Dick.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (entering) Hey.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER AND JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Listen, I-I need a favor. Umm, I was in the shower, and as I was cleansing myself, I ah, I-I, well I felt something.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Was it like a sneeze only better?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, no, I mean, I mean a thing on my body.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (with a disgusted look) What was it?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, I don't know, it's-it's kinda in a place that's not... It's not visually accessible to me, and I was hoping maybe you guys could-could help me out. (starts to take off his pants)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER AND JOEY
dialogue.text: Whoa!!!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No!!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Come on you guys, it's no big deal! (He turns around and shows him his thing.)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Whoa-heeeiiiiii-iiiii-ah!! (sees it) Huh.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well what is it? Is it a mole? (He moves closer to them, and they jump back.)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No, it's too wrinkly to be a mole.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, eww. What? Is it a pimple?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No, it's... fancier than a pimple. Look Ross, why don't you just go see a…

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (entering, interrupting them) Hey guys! What's... (sees what they're doing and stops, the guys are stunned)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, well, it's definite, two more weeks of winter.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ahhh.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, right.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler and Joey are playing with the duck and the
chick.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler, Joey, and Rachel are there, as Phoebe enters with her
date.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (to her date) Okay, and then this is the coffee house. This is where I play my music. (points to the stage)

dialogue.speaker: VINCE
dialogue.text: Good deal.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, and these are my friends. People. This is Vince, Vince the people.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hi!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: VINCE
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Vince is a fireman.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Wow! Have you ever rescued anyone from a burning building before?

dialogue.speaker: VINCE
dialogue.text: 98 hot saves, highest in the force.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, y'know if Joey and I played with matches we could get you up to an even hundred.

dialogue.speaker: VINCE
dialogue.text: (dead serious) Fire safety is not a joke, son.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You're right, I know.

dialogue.speaker: VINCE
dialogue.text: (to Phoebe) Look, I gotta go. I'm on call tonight. (kisses her) See you Saturday. (leaves)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay. (watches him leave)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Wow, he's cute, Pheebs! But I thought you just started dating that Kindergarten teacher.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, Jason? Yeah, uh-huh, we're seeing each other tonight.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What-Pheebs?! Two dates in one day? That's so unlike you.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I know, I know! I'm like playing the field. Y'know? Like, juggling two guys, I'm sowing my wild oats. Y'know? Y'know, this kind've like y'know oat-sowin', field-playin' juggler.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: So Pheebs, do they know about each other?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Does a dog's lips move when he reads? (Joey makes an `I don't know' face, and looks to Chandler and Rachel, who're also stumped) Okay, no they don't.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (entering) Hey guys!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hi!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (going over to him) Well?!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (joining them) Okay, how'd it go at the doctor's?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, he said there's definitely nothing to worry about, it's totally benign.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well what is it?!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: He couldn't even tell me! He said it was just some sort of skin... abnormality. And the worst thing is he-he-he said, he said, without being able to identify it, he was reluctant to remove it.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Y'know what? You should go to my guy, because when I went in there with my third nipple. He just lopped it right off. Y'know? So I guess I'm lucky. I mean not as lucky as people who were born with two nipples.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: At least they knew what yours was. Y'know, yours had a name.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh! Maybe they'll name yours after you! Y'know, they'll call it, The Ross. And then people would be like, "Awww, he's got a Ross."

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (sarcastic) Yeah, that'd be cool!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Pete's breaking up with me.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: What?!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I just checked my messages, and he said that when he gets back from Atlanta, we need to talk.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: And?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well that's it. People never say `We need to talk' unless it's something bad.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Whoa, that doesn't necessarily mean that he's breaking up with you.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Really?!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, maybe he just cheated on you.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler, Joey, and Rachel are there, as Phoebe enters with her
date.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: A Street, Phoebe is walking with her second date, Jason.]

dialogue.speaker: JASON
dialogue.text: ...and I know I'll never miss doing it, but I gotta tell you, it's pretty cool knowing that you're making a difference in a kid's life.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: That is so great! Oh, I... (sees that a parked car near them has caught on fire) Oh my God!

dialogue.speaker: JASON
dialogue.text: Whoa!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (the fire has worsened) Oh my God!!!

dialogue.speaker: JASON
dialogue.text: Ahh-ahh, we'd better call the fire department!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (stopping him) No! No!

dialogue.speaker: JASON
dialogue.text: No, no?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, we don't n-n-n-n-need a fireman, we'd, we'd like a good mechanic. (hears the sound of approaching sirens) Oh my God, here they come! Well, we gotta get out of here!

dialogue.speaker: JASON
dialogue.text: W-w-w-wait! Why?!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well look, if I wanted to see a fireman, I would date one. Okay? (she drags him away)

scenes.event_description: [Scene: A Street, Phoebe is walking with her second date, Jason.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: A Doctor's Office, Ross is having his thing looked at by Dr. Rhodes.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Th-th-that's all it is, a third nipple. Y'know? Just your run-of-the-mill third nipple. Y'know? You can take it off. Just slice that baby right off!

dialogue.speaker: DR. RHODES
dialogue.text: Take your shirt off, and let's see what we're dealing with here. (Ross starts to take off his pants) What are you doing?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Just showing you my run-of-the-mill-slice-it-right-off third nipple.

dialogue.speaker: DR. RHODES
dialogue.text: Well that's not a third nipple.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No?

dialogue.speaker: DR. RHODES
dialogue.text: First of all, it's on your ass.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well then, what is it?!

dialogue.speaker: DR. RHODES
dialogue.text: Wait a minute, hold it. (He goes to the door and opens it.) Johnson! Will you come in here a moment?

dialogue.speaker: DR. JOHNSON
dialogue.text: I'm with Hamilton!

dialogue.speaker: DR. RHODES
dialogue.text: He's good with rear things, bring him in too.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: A Doctor's Office, Ross is having his thing looked at by Dr. Rhodes.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Chandler, Monica, and Joey are there.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (starting to get up) I gotta go water Pete's plants. (stops) Y'know what, if he's gonna break up with me, maybe I won't water his plants.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, if he's gonna break up with you, maybe Joey and I should water his plants. If y'know what I mean.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Or ha-ha, we could go over there and pee on them.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (entering with Rachel) …and I-I can't take it! Y'know? I'm just, always afraid one of them is gonna catch me with the other one. It's making me crazy.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well honey, then why don't you break up with one of them?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (disgusted) Uh.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Whoa-whoa-whoa. What ah, what happened to playing the field?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, it just, it doesn't feel like playing anymore, it feels like work. It's like I'm working in the field.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: So Pheebs, pick one of them.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah. Which one do you like more?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, Vince is great, y'know `cause, he's like a guy, guy. Y'know? He's so burly, he's sooo very burly. (giggles)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Okay, good, so there you go. Go with Vince.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, but Jason's really sensitive.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well sensitive is important, pick him.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh sure, go with the sissy.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Jason is not a sissy!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh no-no-no-no, I meant Chandler.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Chandler, Monica, and Joey are there.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Dr. Rhodes's Office, a rather large group of doctors has now gathered to take a
look at Ross's thing. Ross is none too pleased with the developments, he has a disgusted
look on his face.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Y'know I have dinner plans!!

dialogue.speaker: DR. RHODES
dialogue.text: Thank you soo much for coming on such a short notice. Ladies and gentlemen, I've-I've-I've been practicing medicine for twenty-three years, and I'm stumped.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Whoa. (they all lean in to get a closer look, Ross isn't pleased)

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Dr. Rhodes's Office, a rather large group of doctors has now gathered to take a
look at Ross's thing. Ross is none too pleased with the developments, he has a disgusted
look on his face.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Pete's apartment, Monica is there to water the plants, and is showing the gang
around.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay, this is the den. All right, check this out. Lights! (the lights turn on automatically, but are very bright) Whoa! All right. Less lights! Bad lights! Lights go away! (they dim) Oh, see you just need to find the right command.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yes, and the dimmer switch.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Whoa! For a rich guy he's got, that's a pretty small TV.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No-no-no, that's a video-phone. But hey guys you're not supposed to be here, so please, do not touch anything.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (sitting down on the couch) I-kea! This is comfortable.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (entering with Phoebe) This place is amazing.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: God, that is the nicest kitchen.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I know.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No! But it's the nicest kitchen, the refrigerator told me to have a great day.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Look at this! A millionaire's checkbook.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Joey, put that down! (the phone rings) Oh my God! It's Pete. Okay, get out!! How the hell do you answer a video-phone! (steps in front of it, and automatically answers it)

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Monica? (the gang ducks and hides)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I guess that's how.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Hey Monica, how's it going.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh it’s umm, good! It's umm, it’s good, just here watering the plants.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Well don't forget that fiches over there by Rachel.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (standing up) Ahh... Chandler's on the couch!!

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: I see him, you guys are just the worst hiders ever.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: (standing up) Hey Pete.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hi, how ya doing?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ahh, Pete, the other day when you said you needed to talk, umm, just so I know, is it good news or bad news.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Oh, it's good news. No, it's definitely good news. Hold on a second, I have another call. (clicks his remote) (to his other call) Hey, how's it going?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh no-no-no, it's still me.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Ah, no it's not. I've got picture-in-picture here. (to other caller) Yeah. (listens) Yeah, okay. I'm gonna have to call you back later. (pause) Monica? You. I'm gonna have to call you back.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, oh, okay umm, so I'll see you soon.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Okay, I love you.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I love you.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: I love you, love you.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay. Well, it's good news. It's good news.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: So, what do you thing the good news is?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (looking at the checkbook) Wow! Look at this! He wrote a check for 50,000 dollars to Hugo Ligrens Ring Design. (Monica is stunned) Oh, sorry, what do you think the good news is?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh my.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Monica's gonna marry a millionaire!!!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey, you gotta get Mom on the phone. Call Mom! Call Mom!

dialogue.speaker: PETE'S MOM
dialogue.text: Hello.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: And that's Pete's Mom.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Pete's apartment, Monica is there to water the plants, and is showing the gang
around.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the gang is returning from Pete’s.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Mon you definitely have to make it a theme wedding, and the theme could be, “Look how much money we’ve got!” Y'know, I mean you could put, you could put money in-in the invitations! You-you could have like little money place settings. And ah, you could start with a money salad! I mean it’ll be dry, but people will like it.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Would you stop? We’ve only been going out a couple of weeks, I mean we don’t even know if he’s gonna propose.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes, but this is Pete. Okay? He’s not like other people, on your first date he took you to Rome. For most guys that’s like a third or fourth date kinda thing.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well if-if that’s what it is, then it’s-it’s crazy.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Monica’s right. We’re talking about getting married here. Okay? She-she can’t just rush into this.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh please, what do you know! You married a lesbian!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: All right. I gotta go. I have break up with Vince.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, so you’re going with the teacher, huh?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, I like Vince a lot, y'know? But, it’s just Jason’s so sensitive, y'know? And in the long run, I think sensitive it’s just better than having just like a really, really, really nice (pause) butt. (Her eyes glaze over thinking about the butt.) (pause) Jason! Definitely Jason! Okay, wish me luck!

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Good luck!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: OH MY GOD!!! (She holds her hands up in triumph and the gang all look at her.) Sorry, I was just imagining what it’d be like to catch the money bouquet.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the gang is returning from Pete’s.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: A Fire House, Phoebe has gone to break up with Vince.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Excuse me. Umm, is Vince here?

dialogue.speaker: FIREMAN
dialogue.text: Oh sure. Vince?!

dialogue.speaker: VINCE
dialogue.text: Yo!! (slides down that pole that fire station’s have)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Wow! I didn’t know you guys actually used those.

dialogue.speaker: VINCE
dialogue.text: So, what’s up?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Umm, wow. This-this isn’t gonna be easy. Umm, I don’t think we should see each other anymore.

dialogue.speaker: VINCE
dialogue.text: Uh-huh. G-good deal.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I’m sorry.

dialogue.speaker: VINCE
dialogue.text: No-no it’s okay. It’s just that ah, I thought we had something pretty special here. And y'know I-I felt like you were someone I could finally open up to, and… (starts choking up) That there’s so much in me I have to share with you yet.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh my God, I didn’t…

dialogue.speaker: VINCE
dialogue.text: (starting to cry) I’m sorry, I can’t talk. I’m gonna go write in my journal. (walks away)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (running after him) Wait-wait-wait! Wait!!

scenes.event_description: [Scene: A Fire House, Phoebe has gone to break up with Vince.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe, Ross, and Monica are there.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (to Ross) I’m telling you, if you want to take care of that thing, you should go to my herbal guy.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Thank you, but I want to remove it Pheebs. I don’t want to make it savory.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Y'know when girls sleep with guys with weird things on their body, they tell their friends about it.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Gimme this. (Grabs the herbalist’s card and leaves.)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (entering) Hi! Okay, don’t be mad at me, but I couldn’t resist.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Brides magazines?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yes, and I know that you’d say no if he asked you, but I’m sorry; how great would you look walking down the aisle in this Donna Carin. (shows her the picture.)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (gasps) Oh, you so would! Oh, you should get that anyway. (They both look at her.) Like for clubbing.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: It is so weird, I know what I said, but uh, this morning, I was lying in bed I was, I was imagining what it would be like to say yes. (Rachel slams the magazine shut in amazement.) I know it’s a little sudden, and it’s a little rushed, and it’s totally not like me to do something like this, but that doesn’t mean I can’t. Right? I mean I’m-I’m crazy about Pete, and I know that we want the same things, and when I thought about saying yes, it made me really happy.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh my God. (starting to cry)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I know. (pause) I need more pie. (goes and gets some)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hey Mon umm, if you do get married, can I bring two guests?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You didn’t break up with that fireman?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, that was my way of telling you. Well, it turns out he’s incredibly sensitive, he keeps a journal and he paints. He even showed me charcoal drawings that he drew of me.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Wow!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, well he’d prefer water colors, but y'know, he has easy access to a lot of charcoal.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: So then, are you going to dump Jason?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, yeah, because I have to break up with someone, and… Okay so Jason is sensitive, (holds up one finger) but now so’s Vince (holds up one finger on her other hand) Plus, Vince has the body y'know? (holds up two more fingers on the Vince side) So… It’s really just about the math.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe, Ross, and Monica are there.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Jason’s apartment, Phoebe has gone to break up with Jason.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (knocks on the door) Jason?

dialogue.speaker: JASON
dialogue.text: Yeah, come on in.

dialogue.speaker: JASON
dialogue.text: So Phoebe, you ah, sounded kinda serious on the phone, is ah, is anything wrong?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Nah-ha!

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Jason’s apartment, Phoebe has gone to break up with Jason.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Phoebe’s Herbal Guy’s office, Ross is there about his thing. Ross is
looking around the exam room, and he goes over to a large bank of drawers, pulls one out
and almost spills it as the herbalist, Guru Saj, enters.]

dialogue.speaker: GURU SAJ
dialogue.text: You must be Ross.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: GURU SAJ
dialogue.text: I am Guru Saj. (takes the drawer back and replaces)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Listen, I got to tell you I’ve-I’ve never been to a guru before, so...

dialogue.speaker: GURU SAJ
dialogue.text: Well, relax. If it makes you feel better, I’ve attended some of the finest medical schools in Central America. Well then, let’s take a look at this skin abnormality of yours. (motions to the table) Come on, have a seat. (looks at it) Eeh, huh. As I suspected, it’s a koondis!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What’s a koondis?

dialogue.speaker: GURU SAJ
dialogue.text: I don’t know, what’s a koondis with you? (starts laughing as if that joke was funny, Ross only looks at him, and he stops) Please, lie down! I’ve got a sav that oughta shrink that right up.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I guess it’s worth a try.

dialogue.speaker: GURU SAJ
dialogue.text: Oh sure, we should see results—Whoa!! Clearly not the way to go!! (quickly wipes it off)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What?! What?!

dialogue.speaker: GURU SAJ
dialogue.text: We appear to have angered it.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: We?! We angered it?!

dialogue.speaker: GURU SAJ
dialogue.text: Oh, I think I see the problem. And I’m afraid we’re gonna have to use a much stronger tool. (Ross gives him a ‘What?’ look) Love.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh God!

dialogue.speaker: GURU SAJ
dialogue.text: (He starts moving his hands around in circles above the thing.) Ross, there is absolutely no way this is going to come off unless you start to…

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ow!!

dialogue.speaker: GURU SAJ
dialogue.text: Oops.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What was, what was that?

dialogue.speaker: GURU SAJ
dialogue.text: Well it’s gone.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What?! How’s that?

dialogue.speaker: GURU SAJ
dialogue.text: It got caught on my watch.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey! (congratulates him)

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Phoebe’s Herbal Guy’s office, Ross is there about his thing. Ross is
looking around the exam room, and he goes over to a large bank of drawers, pulls one out
and almost spills it as the herbalist, Guru Saj, enters.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Pete’s apartment, Pete and Monica are coming back from a date.]

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Lights. (The lights turn on, once again they’re too bright.) Uh, romantic lights. (The lights dim.)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ooh, nice.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: So ah, there was this thing I wanted to talk to you about.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, right! I completely forgot about that.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Well ah, I’ve been doing a lot of thinking, and I look at my life…

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah?

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: And I feel like I’ve conquered the business world, and I feel like I’ve conquered the intellectual world, and now I-I have the most beautiful woman in the world.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Wow.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: There’s one thing missing.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What’s that?

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: It’s time for me to conquer the physical world.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay. (not sure of herself)

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Monica, I want to become (pause) the Ultimate Fighting Champion.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You wanna what?!

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: I want to become the Ultimate Fighting Champion! It’s the most intense physical competition in the world, it’s banned in 49 states!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What are you talking about?

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Okay, my trainer, Ho Chi, is teaching me a combination of Gee Koon Doe and Brazilian street fighting, I’ve even had my own octagon training ring designed.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: And I suppose you used a ring designer for that.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Yeah. Monica, I want you there in the front row when I win. I want you close enough to smell the blood. What do you think?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: My parents will be so happy.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Pete’s apartment, Pete and Monica are coming back from a date.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe’s singing, Vince is also there.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (singing) “Crazy underwear, creepin’ up my butt. (Jason enters) Crazy underwear, always in a rut. Crazy under-(sees Jason)-wear…” (In her head) Oh No! What is he doing here? All right, just keep playing, just keep playing. You’ll get through this; you’ll be fine. (She tries to continue the song, but she has lost the ability to pronounce words, and the lyrics come out as gibberish.) (giving up on the song) Okay, thank you. And, as always no one talk to me after the show.

dialogue.speaker: JASON
dialogue.text: (going up to her) Hey. I was…

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: JASON
dialogue.text: I was passin’ by and I saw that you were playing tonight, it’s kinda cool seeing you up there. (kisses her)

dialogue.speaker: VINCE
dialogue.text: (running over) Whoa! Hey-hey! What’s going on here? Who is this guy?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I don’t know, he just started kissing me. Get him! Get him, Vince!

dialogue.speaker: VINCE
dialogue.text: What?!

dialogue.speaker: JASON
dialogue.text: What?!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, okay, I’ve-I’ve been dating both of you, and it’s been really horrible. ‘Cause y'know it’s been a lot of fun, for me. Umm, but I-I like you both, and I, and I didn’t know how to chose, so... I’m sorry, I’m just, I’m terrible, I’m a terrible person. I’m terrible.

dialogue.speaker: VINCE
dialogue.text: Phoebe, Phoebe relax, it’s okay. I mean we never said this was exclusive.

dialogue.speaker: JASON
dialogue.text: Yeah, and neither did we. Give yourself a break.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Really?!

dialogue.speaker: JASON
dialogue.text: Yeah. I mean y'know, we haven’t been going out that long. Come on, we haven’t even slept together yet. Huh.

dialogue.speaker: VINCE
dialogue.text: You haven’t?

dialogue.speaker: JASON
dialogue.text: You have?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, this is none of my business. (starts to walk away)

dialogue.speaker: JASON
dialogue.text: (to Phoebe) I-I can’t believe this! You-you’ve slept with him?!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, I made you a candle light dinner in the park.

dialogue.speaker: JASON
dialogue.text: Y'know Phoebe, I’m gonna make this real easy for you. (walks out)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (to Vince) Well, that could’ve been really awkward.

dialogue.speaker: VINCE
dialogue.text: You made him a candle light dinner in the park?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, but I-I-I-I can do that for you, I’m gonna do that for you.

dialogue.speaker: VINCE
dialogue.text: Uh yeah, I can’t believe I ever went out with somebody who would actually have an open flame in the middle of a wooden area. (walks out)

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe’s singing, Vince is also there.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Guru Saj’s office: Joey and Chandler have taken the duck to see the guru.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (comforting the duck) Everything’s gonna be all right. Okay, Dick?

dialogue.speaker: GURU SAJ
dialogue.text: (entering) Hello, I am Guru Saj-(sees the duck)-Whoa!! (to Joey) That’s supposed to be a duck right? ‘Cause otherwise, this is waaay out of my league.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, yeah. He’s got a, he’s got a really bad cough, and our vet, he can’t do anything about it. Is there something you can do?

dialogue.speaker: GURU SAJ
dialogue.text: Hmm, let me see. Let me see. Do you think you could get him to eat a bat?

scenes.location: Guru Saj’s office: Joey and Chandler have taken the duck to see the guru.
scenes.event_description: [Scene: Guru Saj’s office: Joey and Chandler have taken the duck to see the guru.]
